formattedAddress: 48 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 48 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: The empanadas were amazing! They were filled to the brim and the dough they use compliments the flavors. My favorite was the guava and cheese. Probably the best guava and cheese I ever had and the mango pork was banging. Truly, all the flavors are lit. Go get some !

text.text: The empanadas were amazing! They were filled to the brim and the dough they use compliments the flavors. My favorite was the guava and cheese. Probably the best guava and cheese I ever had and the mango pork was banging. Truly, all the flavors are lit. Go get some !

originalText.text:
My recent visit to NADA, the empanada place with its colorful outer layers and enticing fillings, left me with mixed feelings. While the concept of visually appealing empanadas intrigued me, the overall experience fell short of my expectations.

The variety of fillings offered at NADA is worth mentioning. We opted for the Mango Pork empanada and the Spinach and Cheese empanada. The flavors were decent, and I appreciated the contrasting combinations. The mango pork had a subtle sweetness that complemented the savory pork, while the spinach and cheese provided a satisfying blend of creamy and earthy flavors.

A positive aspect of our visit was the side serving of hot sauce. It added a pleasant kick to the empanadas, enhancing the overall taste. Kudos to NADA for offering this flavorful addition.

However, despite the uniqueness in appearance and flavor, there were some areas that could be improved. The empanada dough, while visually appealing, lacked the desired texture. It was slightly doughy and could have been crispier. The outer layers seemed to overshadow the fillings, resulting in an imbalance in taste and texture.

originalText.text: The vegan beef and sweet plantain and chicken with mashed yucca(?) were two of the best empanadas I’ve ever had! Exquisitely made hard corn shell and fresh healthy homemade filling.

text.text: The vegan beef and sweet plantain and chicken with mashed yucca(?) were two of the best empanadas I’ve ever had! Exquisitely made hard corn shell and fresh healthy homemade filling.

originalText.text: Nadas Columbian Gluten Free rainbow empanadas provides a nice variety of delicious food. The empanadas come in a variety of colors depending on the flavors and filling. Be ready to take out because no seating inside. Each flavor was delicious and unique. Definitely worth a meal.

text.text: Nadas Columbian Gluten Free rainbow empanadas provides a nice variety of delicious food. The empanadas come in a variety of colors depending on the flavors and filling. Be ready to take out because no seating inside. Each flavor was delicious and unique. Definitely worth a meal.

originalText.text: 4/10/2023, Monday:  I picked up a variety of the Nadas empanadas in the west village on Greenwich Ave just north of  10th st, and east of 7th ave in NYC.  It was already packaged even though I'd prefer to take it in my stainless steel restaurant prep containers to avoid the packaging.    This food venue is famous for the gluten-free corn based fried empanadas cooked as they are in Colombia and come with a hot Aji red sauce to dip them in.  I received most of the color varieties, and the website lists the type / flavor and ingredients for each type.  Some are meat based, and others are vegan, and others vegetarian, and some cheese or egg based.
